body: // Don't forget to inject the \$ionicLoading service to your controller! This example also uses \$timeout, so inject that service as well if you plan to use it.
// To fully enable IntelliSense for the \$ionicLoading and \$timeout services, add the following lines to the JSDoc header of your controller:

template: '${1:Content to show while loading. You can also use an HTML template by using the templateUrl property instead.}'
template: '${1:Content to show while loading. You can also use an HTML template by using the templateUrl property instead.}'

body: // Don't forget to inject the \$ionicModal service to your controller! This example also uses \$timeout, so inject that service as well if you plan to use it.
// To fully enable IntelliSense for the \$ionicModal and \$timeout services, add the following lines to the JSDoc header of your controller:
// Create the Modal using an HTML template. You can also use the fromTemplate() method to provide the template directly in a string.
// Show a modal for one second
// Cleanup the modal when we're done with it
// Don't forget to inject the \$ionicPopover service to your controller!
// To fully enable IntelliSense for the \$ionicPopover service, add the following line to the JSDoc header of your controller:
// Create the Popover using an HTML template. You can also use the fromTemplate() method to provide the template directly in a string.
// Cleanup the popover when we're done with it
// Don't forget to inject the \$ionicPopup service to your controller!
// To fully enable IntelliSense for the \$ionicPopup service, add the following line to the JSDoc header of your controller:
template: '${2:The body of the popup. You can also use an HTML template by using the templateUrl property instead.}'
